top_comment.text:
hola, por desgracia en mi país Colombia solo encuentro viruta de madera o 
arena de gato, y se que eso es muy dañino para estos animalitos entonces 
que puedo hacer, ayuda por favor, ah y otra cosa tengo a un macho y una 
hembra los junte para que se aparearan pero de tanto intentos fallidos me 
confie y fue entonces cuando ella quedo embarazada y yo no me lo esperaba 
por lo que no le prepare para su nido ni le suministre los nutrientes 
necesarios y se comio a una cria las otras 3 se las metia en la bolsas y 
salian palidas muertas, :( me puse muy triste y tambien tuve en cuenta que 
no podia acercarme mucho, no pude hacer nada :'(
por favor responde a este mensaje, gracias.﻿
top_comment.author: Alex MercaDo

comments.text:
Hola Alex,
Con 10 litros y para hasmsters, tienes para un montón de tiempo!
El papel higiénico tienes que cambiárselo prácticamente cada día, ya que en 
cuanto se humedece se hace una pasta.
Un saludo.
comments.author: CyPmascota

comments.text:
+CyPmascota pues finalmente encontré carefresh pero en otra ciudad Medellín 
y vale 75mil pesos la bolsa de 28 litros eso en euros serian más o menos 35 
euros, pero cuanto rinden 28 litros? Hay otra bolsa de 10 litros vale 35 
mil pesos como unos 13 euros pero no entiendo eso es litros porque eso no 
es líquido es papel prensado, por ahora les puse papel higiénico partido en 
pedazos, eso está bien? Gracias por responder
comments.author: Alex MercaDo

comments.text:
Hola Alex,
Sentimos que las pequeñinas no salieran adelante...
Por otro lado, no hay en su país algún sustrato aunque sea de madera, pero 
que esté prensado? El papel de periódico a tiras o el de cocina o el de 
baño, son poco absorbentes y se convierten en pasta de papel...
Sentimos no poder ser de más ayuda, pero desconocemos los productos que se 
encuentran en su país.
Un abrazo.
comments.author: CyPmascota

top_comment.text:
Hola, tengo un hámster ruso hembra ya desde un año y ocho meses. La cosa es 
que me gustaría comprar otro hámster hembra para hacerle compañía porque la 
veo muy sola, pero como ya lleva todo ese tiempo conmigo, ¿ le podria 
comprar un compañero o es demasiado tarde ya ? Mi duda es que mi hámster es 
un poco agresiva; no se deja coger , muerde... Si le pusiera otra hámster 
hembra, ¿ se llevarían bien o se pelearían ? He buscado información sobre 
tener dos hámster hembras en una misma jaula y ponía que no era aconsejable 
poner dos en una misma jaula ya que se pelearía porque son muy 
territoriales,pero ahora que he visto tu vídeo;sabiendo que eres 
veterinario y que dices que son animales que le gusta la compañía, ¿ que me 
aconsejarías ? 
Gracias de antemano.﻿
top_comment.author: Okarei Nyu

comments.text: Muchísimas gracias :)
comments.author: Okarei Nyu

comments.text:
+Okarei Nyu Hola, con esta edad ya sera dificil que le traigas una 
compañera y que no pelee con ella.. Las hembras se llevan muy bien y no 
suelen pelear si han crecido juntas, pero si no es el caso es mejor no 
cambiarle en nada su ritmo de vida.
comments.author: CyPmascota

top_comment.text:
He leido por muchos sitios que los hamsters rusos se atacan si viven mas de 
uno en una misma jaula... Tambien he visto que viven solos en naturaleza, 
no que sean greagrios, realmente no se que creer ya... ¿Realmente es seguro 
para ellos tener grupos (de hembras unicamente)? Argumentos en la respuesta 
por favor, no quisiera comprar mas de un hamster y que se lastimaran entre 
ellos...﻿
top_comment.author: gonzaloamide

comments.text:
+Luis Miguel Miralles Albero Gracias por la info, pues creo que no me la 
jugaré y seguiré de uno en uno por sus seguridad y mi tranquilidad!
comments.author: gonzaloamide

comments.text:
Nosotros compramos 2 hembras de hamster ruso porque nos dijeron que no 
pasaba nada y una acabó matando a la otra... Y a mi cuñada le pasó lo mismo 
:(
comments.author: Luis Miguel Miralles Albero

comments.text: +CyPmascota muchas gracias por la información!
comments.author: gonzaloamide

comments.text:
+gonzaloamide Si, se atacan si se trata de machos. Nosotros siempre decimos 
que pueden vivir juntos si son hembras y eso es practicamente por nuestra 
experiencia de criadores. Los machos se pelean de manera muy violenta y no 
se pueden juntar en la misma jaula. Las hembras pueden vivir tranquilamente 
en grupos, no suelen pelear. Esto lo decimos siempre porque mucha gente 
quiere tener mas de una mascota y queremos que entiendan como los pueden 
juntar y como no.
comments.author: CyPmascota

top_comment.text:
Hola Antonio Rodríguez o CyPmascota, te quería decir que mis hamster no me 
di cuenta de que eran hermanos y cuando se hicieron mayores (Eran Macho y 
Hembra) se peleaban, era hamster ruso y se murieron pero ya tenían 3 meses 
o 4, claro que les separé. Bueno y mi madre. Yo estaba un día (El Sábado 22 
de Diciembre de 2013) mi madre e despertó de la siesta y estaban muertos, 
el Macho Gris tenía un tumor, pero yo le quería llevar al veterinario pero 
mi padre me decía que era ridículo. Luego la Hembra estaba sanísima, no 
tenía ni tubo ninguna enfermedad pero la ví muerta con la boquita abierta y 
lo ojos abiertos muerta T-T LOS  DOS MUERTOS, estaban en la cocina, mi 
madre dijo que antes de que se murieran se mareó al salir de la cocina.  Yo 
les quise llevar a la tienda donde los compramos, se les damos y...﻿
top_comment.author: NataliaMH CP

comments.text:
No sé que paso, pero cuando entré a la cocina vi hecha un desastre, estaba, 
no sé, el techo con un color más oscuro y más cosas... Cuando fuimos a 
llamar al de la caldera, se lo contamos y dijo que murieron mareados :( Por 
eso el Hamster que tenemos no lo hemos dejado nunca en la cocina, aunque 
nos hallamos mudado, me da miedo...
comments.author: NataliaMH CP

cuanto a la casita, una vez a la semana esta bien, pero si no ensucia

intenta ponerlo cuanto mas lejos de la tele.

top_comment.text:
Hola! Quiero un hamster ruso pero tengo una duda. Soy de Venezuela y en el 
lugar en donde vivo hace DEMASIADO calor (máximo unos 34°C con sensacion 
térmica de 38-40°C en las tardes), quería saber si esto afecta mucho al 
hamster y como puedo solucionar para que este fresco.﻿
top_comment.author: minibanana

comments.text:
A todos los animales les sientan mal los excesos, sean de lo que sean. Con 
demasiada temperatura puede darles un golpe de calor, y si están varios 
días por debajo de 14 grados, pueden ponerse a hibernar.
Un saludo.
comments.author: CyPmascota

comments.text: Gracias! ¿Pero que hay del calor? :)

3. A la hora de lavar la jaula ¿es mejor hacerlo con vinagre para no 
utilizar detergentes químicos?
4. ¿Es bueno dejar al hamster libre por la casa y dejar que se lleve 
alimento a rinconcitos? (Por supuesto teniendo cuidado que no pueda salir a 
un balcón poniendo algún tipo de obstáculo que selle bien la salida a este)

+Miguel Font 1. el hamster no se va a comer la pintura, en este sentido no 
hay preocupacion. 2. las rejas las tendras que lavar solo si estan sucias, 
pero de vez en cuando les puedes dar un agua. 3. puedes hacer una mezcla de 
agua, vinagre y limon ( 60-20-20) y limpiarla si no te fias de los 
productos del supermercado.4.si dejas a tu hamster libre por casa, es 
posible que no lo veas nunca mas :)))

captions.text: Subscribe to our english channel: Everything about your pet!
https://www.youtube.com/user/allaboutyourpet
Hello friends,
Here I am.
I want to explain how to assemble and prepare the hamster's cage.
We need very few things. Hamsters are very good pets.
Almost everyone has had a hamster when kids, even me.
The trouth is that they are excellent pets if you touch and play with them since they are
young, and we need very few things to take care of them. The first and most
important is the cage. What type of cage do we need? So here you have one, almost
all the pet shops have hamster cages.
It is important that it has a tunnel like the one you can see here
because they love to run through the tunnels. They are like the mice
in this aspect.
They make underground tunnels and have storerooms where
they keep
all the food they can find. Another important factor and that you have
surely seen
is the exercise wheel.
You might have seen that
lately the exercise wheels,
are being manufacturerd without holes.
Maybe some of you will remember that these exercise wheels used to have
racks and steps, and the animals could catch their feet in
them
and get trapped. So the
best exercise wheels are these
that as
you can see
the animal cannot catch his feet anywhere.
The second step is to
explain you a bit the sizes of the cage.
You see here. Hamsters do not need a very big cage because the are
small animals. It is interesting that we let them out of the cage and let them run around the house
for them to have some exercise, but their cage should be more or less like this one here,
of approximately 40 by 30 or 30 x 40, as I have said, we don't need
big cages, especially if we can let them out for some exercise and run around the house.
It is important to fill in the base of the cage with an appropriate and suitable
material for them. We recommend this pressed newspaper. It is very
easy,
we fill it in.
Surely you have seen this in other videos, because this is the natural litter
that we like best
for almost all type of animals.
We fill in generously.
Good.
And, we are talking abount hamsters, but we are missing the most
important, which is the hamsters.
Today I dreamed with with a person that I think will bring me luck, so I will make
my first wish. lets see if its granted.
I need
3 hamsters. Wow!
So here they are! Three precious hamsters,
that will help me to assemble the cage.
As you know,
the first days
an animal arrives at home, we must prepare a very, very calm place.
So, as I've said,
here we have them.
I will place them in their new cage,
we will pick them up very carefully
so they don't get scared.
Hamsters are very gregarious animals that they love to live
in big groups, they are small mammals and they live in
great familys, when wild in nature,
in a way of speaking. They carry on well, but you have to be careful
not to put tow males together as they are very territorial. A male can
live with various females,
and females can live together too, but males are very dominating
and if placed together, they can even hurt themselves.
As you can see, they are very restless, they try to climb
everywhere. Then,
as they have these delicate feet, you have to be very careful
when putting the lid on the cage
not to catch them.
We will always be very delicate.
You will see that they will start to immediately climb.
And as I have said, we have to be very careful
in not catching their feet, because these accidents happen
too often.
We will put the exercise wheel in
so they can have exercise.
It is normal that they have more activity
during the night. These
animals are named animals of twilight habits
because as they are the last ones on the food chain,
all the animals want to eat them.
They like to get out at night, when nobody can see them
and its when they feel more safe. It is normal that during the night
they move around the cage when we are sleeping, and the pitter patter of their
feet running in the exercise
wheel of their cage.
Don't get nervous, they love to do this,
they are very active during the night.
Once we have placed the lid on the cage, we have to put the other things through
the top, to avoid
opening and closing the cage. We see that the
exercise wheel works correctly...
Perfect.
We fasten the cage...Great!
And what is missing? Well, as I've said, the hay,
their shelter. We will put in a generous quantity of hay, especially the first
days so they feel safe and comfortable.
Here we can be generous because hay is like their hiding place
and is also food.
They can eat it as food
just like other small mammals, the same as rabbits,
eat hay.
Also, if you look closer,
you will see that,
as soon as we put in the hay, they start
to play and arrange the hay.
They will eat it and prepare it for their hiding place.
After the hay, we will do the second
important part, which is the water. Even if you see that hamsters don't drink too much,
they must always have fresh clean water available.
Normally, the best type of drinker is like this one,
that everyone knows and recognizes.
Usually, the cages already come with this dinker,
but make sure when you are buying the cage, and if there is no drinker, ask your shop assistant where you
have bought the cage, because if it does not come with the drinker, you will have to buy one
and it is really a serious problem, if their drinkers don't have
this  ball drinking system.
Even if you can even give them water in this normal drinker
this other ball system is much better
and much more easy
for them to drink water
in this ball type of drinker.
This type of ball drinking system will avoid the water to come out, and stores
the water much better.
Finally, we place their food.
You will always find specific foods for hamsters in the market.
We fill in a small bowl
and now, I have to explain you a bit about the food.
We fill in the bowl,
like this more or less,
and so,
we will use a small tablespoon
measure
for each hamster
each day.
You see...it is very easy
to commit errors when feeding hamsters and it is very normal
to see very fat hamsters.
The reason is the following.
As soon as we feed a hamster, they usually run to the feeding bowl
and fill in their cheek pouches, these little sacks that I have told you
they have in their cheeks,
and they will hide it.
So if we see the feeding bowl empty, we
will say "How quickly they have eaten it!"
They have eaten it all up
and as the bowl is empty, we fill it up again
with food and this is a big mistake.
All the hamster has done is take out the food of the food bowl
and taken it to his hiding place using his cheek pouches.
They don't need more food. It is normal, as I've said to find fat hamsters,
because we are filling their food bowls all day, and they
take it out and store it in their hiding place. Today is their first day at home
so we should also give them
a type of prize. We can use snacks. So as all my wishes
are granted today, I wish
I want....snacks for hamsters!!
And here they are.
Fantastic.
But only as a prize, because we cannot over feed them with snacks.
We will give them some seeds of
these that come off. Always very few, because
these are prizes, and we must use them as prizes, only now and then.
Just to finish, I must say
that the first days of the hamsters at home, there must be
a lot of peace and quiet, keep them
shady
so they can relax and enjoy their new place.
So I think that with this,
I have ended.
Well....maybe not!
Its that I'm seeing that all my wishes for hamsters are being granted...and what about me?
Why not? I'm not less than them!
So if everything is being granted for me today,
I'm going to ask for a milion euros, and if the wish is granted, I will share it with you.
One milion euros!
One milion euros!

title: HÁMSTERS - Preparación de la jaula del hámster
